thread.title: Kobe Buffalomeat is the nation’s first 102-star recruit
thread.title_full: Kobe Buffalomeat is the nation’s first 102-star recruit

author: Matt Bonesteel
title: Kobe Buffalomeat is the nation’s first 102-star recruit
text:
By Matt Bonesteel By Matt Bonesteel February 1 at 11:41 AM Follow @MattBonesteel 
Illinois State is something of an FCS powerhouse, having made the championship game in 2014 and the playoffs the last two seasons, but even FCS powerhouses struggle to get much attention on National Signing Day, at least until they sign a player named Kobe Buffalomeat. 
And then all I care about is Illinois State football. Lawrence, Kansas 6'7" OL Kobe Buffalomeat ( @buffalomeat10 ) joins a stacked class up front for the 'Birds #RedbirdNSD17 pic.twitter.com/ng9IhUtZoU 
— Illinois State FB (@RedbirdFB) February 1, 2017 
Here’s a better photo: Lawrence 2017 OL Kobe Buffalomeat headed to play at the FCS level for Illinois State. 6'7 285. 1st Team All-Sunflower League in 2016 pic.twitter.com/g04SMxHJD6 
— Sports in Kansas (@sportsinkansas) January 30, 2017 
Also of note: He plays basketball and goes by “Beef.” Happy birthday to the most photogenic athlete out there. Hope you had yourself a day Beef. 👬👬😸 pic.twitter.com/laaWdE2qcr 
Here’s some video of Buffalomeat straight-up mauling people: Welcome to @RedbirdFB : Kobe BuffalomeatLawrence, KS // Lawrence High School 
— RedbirdHD.tv (@RedbirdHDTV) February 1, 2017 
According to an October story in the Lawrence Journal-World , Buffalomeat played high school football for the first time in three years this past season, mostly focusing on basketball. 
“I kind of picked up where I left off,” he said. “I didn’t forget too many things. Just the fine adjustments you have to make to the steps and stuff.” 
Jordan Peele, of “Key & Peele” funny football names fame, has noticed. You win, God. 🙌🏾🙌🏾🙌🏾 https://t.co/t4hD2LBB3K 
— Jordan Peele (@JordanPeele) February 1, 2017 
Buffalomeat seems to be having a whole lot of fun with his newfound notoriety.
